Use this protocol when you want a user interface element to behave like an outline—a view that uses a row-and-column format to display hierarchical data that can expand and collapse—in the accessibility hierarchy.

# NSAccessibilityOutline

**Protocol**

A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as an outline view.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol NSAccessibilityOutline : NSAccessibilityTable
```

## Overview

Use this protocol when you want a user interface element to behave like an outline—a view that uses a row-and-column format to display hierarchical data that can expand and collapse—in the accessibility hierarchy.

You can further enhance the adopting element by implementing any of the information properties or action methods that the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityProtocol] protocol declares.



Although the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityOutline] protocol doesn’t declare any methods, it does conform to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityTable] protocol. You may need to explicitly implement methods from any of the protocols that [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityOutline] conforms to.

## Lists

- **NSAccessibilityTable**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a table view.
- **NSAccessibilityList**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a list view.
- **NSAccessibilityRow**: A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a row for a table, list, or outline view.

## Inherits From

- NSAccessibilityElementProtocol
- NSAccessibilityGroup
- NSAccessibilityTable
- NSObjectProtocol

## Conforming Types

- NSOutlineView
